text: Everything you need under one roof! Awesome group fitness, one on one training, full size basketball court and a recovery shop. Great coaches who truly care about your well being and push you to get better every day!

resp.text: You are the greatest!!

name: Haleigh Chastain
text: Best facility in Birmingham! The gym has everything you need to train. Nicest equipment around town.

resp.text: Thank you for the awesome review and always being such an awesome customer!

name: P Sayasane
text:
I’ve attempted to schedule a four serenity package given to my daughters and I for Christmas. When I called to schedule earlier this year, I was told I would get a call back once they’ve contacted another masseuse to come in that they would need two and they would contact me back. I informed them if they was unable to schedule the four, I would like to schedule at least two. I never received a call back. I contacted them once again to schedule the four packages by leaving a message on the website and by phone on several different occasion. Once I received a response, I was informed they would have someone call me back and nothing. Left a message on the website and phone once again, Response…they didn’t have a masseuse in but once the masseuse returned or another one staffed I would be priority and we would be scheduled. I gave it 2 weeks and nothing. Left a message on the website again and by phone. Response, they would have to call me back when the new owners or previous owner was in.😱😳
With the COVID and lack of staff the owner (which will now be the previous) was kind enough to honor the now expired packages but to this day still haven’t been able to schedule an appointment.

I informed the person that gave us these gift certificates and it’s a disappointment thinking you’ve selected the best and get this type of response, unable to receive the services paid for.

Lesson learned: Gift certificates is NOT a good choice!

name: Tera Shade
text: In response to the "1 star" review written 3 years ago.  I responded 2 days after it posted but it never showed up, so I'll try again with my response...When this review was first posted the person included her name (it has since been changed to "anonymous").  I called the reviewer and inquired about her time spent at Bliss.  You see, I am the owner and very concerned about our reputation and our guests experience.  I believe the following information will help you decided if you want to take this reviewer seriously.   Let me begin by saying this reviewer called late in the day to make an appointment to have her hair cut.  Even though we were booked until closing time, one of my stylist agreed to stay late and take the appointment.  The two employees behind the desk greeted this reviewer, offered her something to drink, and informed the stylist of her arrival.  Because it was now after closing time, the two front desk employees left for the day.  This reviewer was not left alone or ignored at any time.  The stylist who volunteered to stay late, finished with the client she was with and was on time for this reviewers scheduled appointment.  This reviewer had her hair shampooed, had more of a trim than a cut, and blown out.  She was charged $15.  Her comment about being charged three times what she should have been charged... Well, I don't know where a woman can get her hair shampooed, cut/trimmed, and blown out for $5.  She did say she was new to the area, so maybe she could get the above service done for $5 where ever she moved from...Just to be clear, Bliss does not offer shampoos, haircuts, and styles for $5....  I noticed she did not mention the amount she was charged.   Could it have been she as embarrassed to admit that she thought $15 was "three times more than what it should have been." Because this reviewer posted this review under her name and because we had her phone number on file, I called and inquired about her time at Bliss.  I stated I was the owner and was making follow up calls with our new clients.  I did not  mention I had read her review but instead asked how she enjoyed her visit with us.  I gave her every opportunity to relate any unpleasant experience she might have had.  I was told that Bliss is a beautiful place and was thanked for taking her appointment on such short notice and after hours.  When asked how she like her hair cut even thought it really was only a trim, she responded "I like it, she did a good job." During our conversation, she never said anything negative about her visit at Bliss, and when I invited her to return in the future she said she would.  To be honest, she has not returned .  I wish she had given us another chance so that she could experience what Bliss is really about.  I would also like to respond to the comment about the service being done half-hearted and with no conversation.  The stylist's mother had just passed away very unexpectedly two weeks earlier.  She was still mourning her loss but trying to live as normal as possible and continue to work and support herself.  While this reviewer had no clue what was happening in our stylist personal life, I think because of the comment she made in her review for all to read, its important for you to know why our stylist was not her usual outgoing friendly self.   I am very interested in making each client feel welcome and appreciated.  I personally follow up with as many clients as possible to make sure that their time at Bliss was relaxing and that they are satisfied with their service.  I know this has been a lot to read, but I wanted to give a little more information about the above review.  I am sure I am not the only business owner that is willing to go above and beyond what is normal to make their guest happy.  If something is not what you are expecting, please let us know.  Give us the opportunity to "fix" it.  Our guest are the reason we even have a business and we understand that, without "you" we wouldn't be here.  We look forward to seeing you and making you feel "special" like the person you are!!!

name: Ethan Rayhorn
text: I made an online appointment for the same day and it was confirmed within 5 minutes. I got a 90 minute deep tissue and hot stone massage and it was wonderful. You get a FULL 90 minutes. There was a variety of techniques that I hadn't experienced before and it worked amazingly well on my sore back and shoulders. I love that they are open late too, so I can come in after work. The prices are very fair, and I will not hesitate to come back! Most importantly, I felt like the facility was clean. They wore masks, cleaned the table and headrest with alcohol, changed the sheets and washed their hands. They ask you to wear a mask when face-up on the table. I would want a massage therapist to be clean any time, but especially with covid, it was nice to see that they were doing things right. They also had their alabama LMT licenses at the front counter which is always nice to see when going to a new place and wanting to make sure it is legitimate.

text: I am so grateful they are open once again.   I have missed my massage people.   I was very pleased to see and must admit very impressed with the measures they have taken to keep us safe in this trying time of covid-19.   They have thought of most everything from N-95 mask to hand sanitizer to ultra-violet lights, hands free soap and towels dispensers and increased cleaning between clients.   Thank you.

name: Sandy Morrison
text: Today was my first day back, after the pandemic. I've been seeing Leanne for three years, and was so very excited when Peaceful Solutions decided to open with step one, after the pandemic. This place is amazing, they have brought heppa filters, uv lighting, in which they wait an hour between each appointment so they can make sure each room is completely sanitary. Thank you Leanne for making me and others feel safe and secure while having our needs met. 💜

name: Brad Luce
text: I have been with PS for about 10 years. They offer services for all needs. During the Covid-19 crisis, you can feel completely safe with treatment. They have air purifiers in all rooms, hand sanitizer is everywhere, you have your own personal jar of massage cream, and both you and your massage therapist wear masks. Everything is sanitized during and between sessions. You won’t be disappointed—all of the ladies are great and you can specify who you want to see.

After careful and detailed research Peaceful Solutions has added many touchless products, like soap dispenser, paper towels, air purifiers in every room and sheets are covering everything.  I was not at all hesitant to have a massage in the pandemic, With LeAnne she eased all the uncertainties before I even came.  I have had her for over 5 years and she never ceases to be detailed and current with the times and especially proactive!!!  Thank you LeAnne, my body missed you!!

name: Walter Overby
text: One of the best massages ever!

name: Ja'Nika Phipps
text: **DO NOT PURCHASE GROUPON**  My boyfriend purchased a groupon for services with LeAnne Owen back in May 2017.  I was going came in town to visit for a month after traveling for 3 months straight.  He thought this would be a good idea for me to relax.  When I received the groupon via email,  I called to schedule an appointment (as suggested on the voucher) but I just got the voicemail.  I called a few times over the next couple days because I actually wanted to talk to a person.  But after no response, I followed the instructions from the voicemail, which was to go online to check availability.  Only to find out that the next available day was in September 2017 (4 months later).  I immediately tried to call groupon to get a refund, because I definitely didn't want to wait 4 months for a massage.  However, Groupon was not able to refund me because it was day 4 since he purchased the Groupon.  They have a policy of a 3 day return.  They were not understanding and didn't care to hear my story.  I decided to try calling LeAnne again, but of course there was no answer.  I left numerous messages and she finally called my back 3 days later.  When she called, my intent was to explain my story to her and advise her I would be there for the next month to see if she could squeeze me in anytime within the next few weeks.  She said rudely said she couldn't and advise me to tell my boyfriend to give the groupon to someone else to use.  I made a suggestion to her to possibly disable her Groupon option until she's caught up, because I'm sure I am not the only potential long term customer with the issue.  She proceeded to rudely yell and tell me that she's backed up because of Mother's day and she doesn't need anyone telling her how to run her business.  Ironically this is the same place I purchased a Groupon for my boyfriend (with a different person) and he had a great experience.  Which is why he decided to do the same for me.  At the end of the day I will never give this place my money again and I will tell everyone I can the same.  My boyfriend basically, gave away money.

resp.text: I am sorry that this person feels this way. I do stay booked out anywhere from 10-14 weeks in general for new clients.  I called the person back as soon as she left a voicemail. I explained to her that if she calls and doesn't leave a voicemail that we don't know someone has called. The client wanted to know about how much money I make and I did tell her it was none of her business as it was also none of her business my relationship with Groupon which stands at 4.7 stars out of 5. I am sorry she feels this is rude, but I find it extremely rude for a stranger to try and tell me how to run my business. As a self employed person not having an opening 2-3 months out  means that I am employed, and that is a good thing. Groupon helps bring new clients in that I hope will become regular clients. I stay booked and I can't fit someone in because they are only going to be in town for a short time that just is what it is. That wouldn't be fair to all the people who wait the standard time for the great deal that Groupon is and I have done over 1500 Groupon massages in the last 3+ years. The person  begins the complaint by saying she was only going to be in town for a month and then talks about how she wouldn't be coming back. If she is only visiting for a short time it sounds like she wouldn't be coming back anyway. I find that most people who leave bad reviews it is because they couldn't bully their way into getting their way and try and get me breaking tmy best practices and rules. The fine print of the Groupn says by availability only. My schedule is online for the whole world to see. The lady wanted me to give her a refund and I told her no bc she didn't buy anything from me she bought a product from Groupon and I do not get all the money from the product. The woman then started asking how much I make  and that was when I told her it was none of her business which it wasn't. Being a therapist who is booked out means I am good at what I do. Groupon is to bring in new clients, not for your next day massage. I tried to help her and offer suggestions but she just wanted to be mad.

name: Johnathan Fail
text: Had a wonderful experience here!

name: Elle M
text:
If you value good customer service in addition to great massages, I would not recommend booking a massage with LeAnne. I bought a Groupon deal for two hour long massages. The first one was great but the second one never happened because LeAnne decided to "leave and go run errands" because I was 10 minutes late. Even though I called the business and left a message saying I was on my way, LeAnne informed me it is her normal practice to immediately leave the building and run errands if a client is not on time. She then told me I should have called her cell phone (which is not listed on the website or business door) instead of the business number.

I have never heard of such! If I have ever been late for a massage anywhere else, the therapist would simply subtract that time away from my appointment. I had taken off work to make this appointment, since this location doesn't offer hours that are convenient to people who work a 9-5 job. It's clear that customer service is not valued here so I will not spend my money at this place again.

resp.text: I wish to state that this client was a repeat client. She had been told upon her first visit to Peaceful Solutions that the office phone was just used to collect voicemails and given a business card with the cell phone number on it. The day in question I waited on the client for 20 minutes including calling the number given. The client did not show up. When a client is 20, not 10 minutes late it is my policy to consider them a no show. This was the second of a 2 massage Groupon deal, and the client states she got a great massage the first time. To give me 1 star because I upheld the company policy of not giving away free massages when people do not follow instructions is her prerogative, but she is the one missing out on great massages, and as for our hours of operation, I am a massage therapist of 20 years experience so no I don't work late or on the weekend, I work 9-5 like most working people because I too have a family to take care of. Namaste

text: My friend and I got facial. TiAmber was our esthetician. She did amazing job and explained the process and product.  She seemed knowledgeable and welcoming.  Overall great experience.  Thank you

name: Des
text: I am highly disappointed with this location’s front-office service, specifically Debra. I had an appointment this evening at 5pm, but woke up experiencing illness so wanted to reschedule my appointment, especially in light of the Covid-19 climate we are still in. I called their office first thing (8am) and explained my illness to Debra and informed her I would like to reschedule. She gave me several run-arounds concerning why even though I was sick I could not reschedule. Even so much as stating the owners are the reason why if a patron feels ill they still have to be serviced. She then said half of my Massage Envy points banked for today’s service would be expensed because of the same day reschedule. I asked what concessions are made for feverish patrons. She said they are still required to show up and Massage Envy would take their temperature. I told her I would be going to the doctor’s office today and could provide an excuse. She said a manager would get back with me today, but no one ever contacted me. After having my suspicions proven that I had been lied to and no one would contact me, I called back to ask about what was the current status of my appointment/points. I was then informed the appointment was taken off the records and all of my points for today’s session had been expensed. I am extremely frustrated with their “customer care”. I feel lied to and with their “Covid protocols” that were exhibited today first-hand to me, I will NEVER feel comfortable patronizing them again. There is no telling how many patrons who have been ill (with or without fevers) have received service and unintentionally spread it to others with the help of this location’s policies. So much for this place being a standard of wellness services. I feel more stressed now after dealing with this than I did before. I wish I had NEVER booked anything with this location or had my home membership at this location.

name: Stephanie Hazen
text: I absolutely love coming here. As a single mom, I don’t have lots of money to spend on spa services. Because of massage envy I am able to spend a little time pampering myself. Whitney has done an absolute miracle on my face with products and chemical peels. I am so happy! With only one very light peel, about 75% of the dark spots I had from sun exposure are gone. The receptionist is absolutely wonderful. She works really hard to apply coupons and discounts whenever she can. The place has always been clean and welcoming. The staff is great. I did so a massage as well and it was very very relaxing. I got the membership and plan to make monthly visits.

resp.text: Thank you Stephanie, for your positive review of Massage Envy - Hoover. All Massage Envy locations are owned and operated by local franchisees who work hard to ensure guests and members are happy with the services they receive. We are so happy to hear you have had such a great experience.

name: Evyan Gallegos
text: Great communication with staff, felt really safe going in with all the covid-procedures.

resp.text: Reviews like this are important and it is greatly appreciated that you took the time to leave your positive feedback for Massage Envy - Hoover. Thank you, Evyan!

name: Maria
text:
Just had a massage. My experience was a 3/5 stars for the following:

1. There was a fan on me the entire time... For one hour, I was covered in oil (and naked with only a sheet covering me) with a fan on me in the middle of winter! I was almost shivering. The bed warmer was either not on or not working.... Bummer. Also, the light in the room was on the whole time... I like it dark and relaxing. Rooms need to be vacuumed.😞

2. My MT was clearly sick with something respiratory going on. Being that close and breathing over me sick was a major deterrent on a return visit. Not sure if he kept stopping the massage to wipe his nose or what but I've never had so many pauses in a massage. 😷I'm used to smooth continuous pressure/ touch during a massage except for when its time to turn. Also, no hot towels this time!!!😩

3. I feel like this particular chain is on the downhill... The past few times I've gone, you can never get the same therapist twice. It appears there is a lot of turnover here. It is noisy in the hallway out side of the room. I made sure to use all of my gift card so my friends and family can start giving me new gift cards to use somewhere new.😐

4. The receptionist stated she was going to look up my gift card towards the balance. I had two cards to use. She couldn't get them at first. Luckily, I had them on me.

*Overall, not a terrible experience but in Hoover, I have many other options to choose from for a good massage and I'll start seeking out those places next. For someone that splurges to have a massage 3 times/ year at most, my expectations were not met for the cost of services rendered.  Staff was friendly. MT gave a decent massage with good pressure (minus all the pauses).

resp.text: Hello Maria, thank you for letting us know about your experience at Massage Envy - Hoover franchised location. We encourage you to reach out to the franchised location through the online portal at http://bit.ly/2mQKBpW to express your concerns and allow them to help address these issues.

text:
Quintette was great and I had a great massage. Debra was very nice and helpful. I also had a facial with Selena. She was late and I was suppose to have an hour and it was only 45 min at best. That included me changing and all. She never discussed products with me other than not to use an abrasive exfoliater on my checks.
She left the headband on and the bed raised up and I slipped getting down since it was still up. I would go back for the massage but would request someone different for a facial.

resp.text: Hello Tracy, on behalf of Massage Envy Franchising thank you for expressing your concerns and bringing this to our attention. Please reach out through the online portal at http://bit.ly/2mQKBpW so this can be addressed.

name: Angeles Vo
text: I got a mysterious rash on my arms after a massage. I notified the receptionist who put a note in the system. I thought maybe I had a one time bad experience, since the rash seemed to go away, so I went back the following month. I got another rash but this time it spread up and down my arms. My doctor told me it looked like a fungal infection but to be safe she would refer me to a dermatologist. I got a doctors note stating I needed to refrain from massages until the dermatologist could determine what the rash was and if it was safe to go back. I took my doctors note and filled out a membership cancellation form. I noticed my monthly fee was withdrawn after I had submitted the form so I called. I was told my cancellation was denied because I needed a note from the dermatologist. I can’t get a dermatologist note for another month when I have my appointment but even so, why is my doctors note not enough? According to their cancellation policy a note from a doctor stating one cannot be massaged for medical reasons should suffice. The manager didn’t even have the decency to call me! I only found out because I called them. I am out $130 and still have one more month before my contract is up. Not to mention the doctor bills. Do not go here! Find a better place to get a massage.

resp.text: Massage Envy is committed to a safe and therapeutic environment. If you feel you have not experienced this at this franchised location, please reach out to the corporate Guest Relations team at guestrelations@massageenvy.com with the details of your experience for further assistance.

text: Not enough space for all the issues. Charter member. Joined 10 years ago. Decided in May 2019 it was in decline and too difficult to book due to incredible staff turnover. Also, the experience had become totally inconsistent. Still fighting them for my legitimate cancellation. When I requested cancellation in May I had TEN unused sessions (because they are so understaffed). Had to burn through those first. Sent in my paperwork and have the email in my SENT emails to prove it. They deny having any knowledge and are still billing me! Totally unprofessional. Avoid at all costs.

resp.text: Hello Cheryl, on behalf of Massage Envy Franchising thank you for expressing your concerns and bringing this to our attention. Please reach out through the online portal at http://bit.ly/2mQKBpW so this can be addressed.

name: ByDezire
text: This place is ridiculous! My girlfriend scheduled a day out for my birthday! She didn’t get the reminder phone call that they supposedly do. When she scheduled the appt. the woman told her to arrive A FEW MINUTES before to fill out paper work. We literally pulled up 10 mins late because of traffic. The girl at the desk told us since we were late the paperwork would cut into the massage by 30 mins and said it wouldn’t be worth it! Also they would only charge 50% of the initial price for cancellation! We rescheduled and they charged the FULL price! My girlfriend literally wasted all this money on a massage and no one laid a hand on me! They’re very horrible with communication and policy between they’re employees! text: I've read these reviews and frankly I was shocked. I had a great experience! My therapist was not only cordial and professional, she also gave me the best massage I've ever had. I've had no issues with billing, and find the staff curtious and hospitable. My therapist's name was Leigh. I would definitely ask for her. She is great and seems to really know what she's doing. I would and have recommended this place to my friends. My guess is that the other complaints on here, are just unhappy people that find fault in everything.

Thank you again for being a valuable guest and we look forward to seeing you again.

name: Christopher Michael
text: I'm surprised to read the negative reviews on here.  I've had great massages with Chance and the customer service staff have always been nice to me.  Due to personal circumstances I had to cancel my membership with Massage Envy which was not an issue after my initial 12 months had ended.  Highly recommend!

resp.text: Christopher Michael, thank you for the kind words and wonderful review! It brings us great joy to see our members and guests happy. We look forward to seeing you again!

name: S
text: Wish zero was an option. Had a giftcard and made a 6:00 massage appointment, arrived at 5:45, got checked in by 6:00, waited 20 minutes and met therapist as I was getting ready to leave. She immediately made excuses for being late and blamed it on a computer system and iPad not showing me as being checked in. What she didnt realize was the fact she had been observed coming in at 6:00 with drinks and food, and eating, which was the real reason she was late, and unconcerned. Tried to take the high road, but she was agitated, ranting, cursing about how the rest of the schedule was all of a sudden thrown off. Also said she was sleepy and frustrated. Canceled my appointment because there was no way I could enjoy my massage with that type of unprofessional behavior. I'm still waiting on a call from the manager which I don't expect to receive. On a positive note, the 2 young receptionists were very cordial. I do not recommend this location at all! Sorry my family wasted $$ on a giftcard.

resp.text: Thanks for your honest feedback. We're deeply disappointed to hear that this was the experience you had with us. At your earliest convenience, please message us through our online portal at http://bit.ly/2mQKBpW so that we can address the details of your review further.

name: Mckinney Chattman
text: Still feel great weeks later and one of the best massages I've had

resp.text: We're excited to hear this! Thank you, Mckinney! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Stephanie Clayton
text: I have been having an issue for 2 months now with this location.   After the desk staff not being trained well enough to handle the request, or just not wanting to, I have asked repeatedly to speak with the manager to no avail and have been transferred to his voicemail, again to no avail.  He will not call me back and he is never in or so they say.  Massage Envy advertises transferring a credit to another member's account (for a fee).  They have charged the fee and have yet to transfer the credit to my sister's membership at another location out of town. Twice now they have set up a guest account for her in Hoover, even after a detailed phone call on May 9, 2016 with a front desk staff to try and rectify this situation because when my sister asked her location if it had transferred and they let her know they had set up a guest account for a half hour in Hoover.  After no help from the Hoover location I called my sister's location out of town and they walked me through how simple the process is to transfer and they themselves cannot understand why I am having issues.  At that point I decided to ask for the manager and I still cannot get any help.  At what point does this surpass bad customer service and become deceptive business practices or fraud because I have paid for a service that they offer but am not getting it?

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to inform us about this situation. We have provided the transfer of your service, as requested. Again, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.

name: Lena Smile
text: My experience was very good. I enjoyed every moment. My therapist was attentive to my needs and very professional. I've had massages all over the US by licenced therapists from the phenomenal to the absolute worst. Massage envy is not only a good experience but it's a great value!

name: Jeannie Dickerson
text: Bad management. Don't do business here!!  I cancelled my membership back in November 2015 and started getting bank drafts again this month. I didn't freeze my account...I cancelled it!!  I've called twice in the past two weeks with no return phone calls. I went down in person and no manager was there and apparently comes and goes with no set schedule according to the staff. I simply want my account completely cancelled and my money refunded. I don't know if the manager is a coward or a thief. I will NEVER be doing business here again and will never refer anyone here for business. The massages were wonderful but the management stinks.

name: Latoya Cunningham
text: Chris the masseuse was amazing!! This was the best experience I have ever had hands down....I frequent massage parlors often! Sandy the esthetician provided me wi th a 5 star facial!! I didn't want to leave! Great atmosphere!

resp.text: Latoya, we are so happy to read such a great review about Massage Envy - Hoover! You really made our day today.

name: Latoya Cunningham
text: Chris the masseuse was amazing!! This was the best experience I have ever had hands down....I frequent massage parlors often! Sandy the esthetician provided me wi th a 5 star facial!! I didn't want to leave! Great atmosphere!

resp.text: Latoya, we are so happy to read such a great review about Massage Envy - Hoover! You really made our day today.

name: Jenn
text:
Almost impossible to get an appointment here. You must make multiple calls to get someone to answer the phone. There is a voicemail. I have left messages but no one returns the call. When I do get a person to answer they are obviously bothered or confused by my request to make an appointment.
The massage therapists are decent  but I absolutely dread calling to make an appointment. So much so that I don't use my massages like I should or could.
I let them charge my debit card once then found out at my next visit that they automatically added it to my file, without my permission, and can charge it whenever they want to now as evidenced by the receptionist telling me she didn't need my signature she can just charge me whenever I come in. Wow.

resp.text: Jenn, first thank you for taking the time to reach out to us with your review and for your praises about our massage therapists! We take great pride in making sure our therapist are well-trained and customer-service oriented. We are sad to hear that this experience did not carry over with our appointment setting process. We do try to accommodate every member and guest, and at times there can be issues when scheduling appointments. Please know that is not how we like to conduct business and that we are working on making changes to solve these issues. Again, we do apologize for this inconvenience to you and if you would like, please call Caleb at (205) 988-6400.

name: LaDonna Tedder
text: This place is terrible!  The main selling point for purchasing a membership was the extended hours they offer for appointments.  Who knew it is completely impossible to get an appointment during the evening and when you are lucky enough to get an appointment, they call a few hours prior to cancel the appointment stating the therapist had resigned.  I would definitely NOT recommend wasting your money here.

name: Brooke Robinson
text: I called in today in reference to a double charge on my bank account for my membership fee. Hannah answered the phone and was very unprofessional and definitely not helpful. Not only was she not able to adequately explain the reason for the double charge, she was refusing to provide any helpful information to help resolve the issue and disconnected our phone call prompting me to call again. I requested the manager and was told he had been out of the office for a week and she had no idea when he would be back. What a joke of an establishment. I requested the Regional Manager name and number, oh but I was advised there was no number for her to provide to file a complaint. Their employees need to be trained or as Hannah explained they do not get paid to offer customer service. I will definitely cancel this membership and tell everyone I know to not patronize this establishment.

resp.text: Brooke, We are very sorry that your bank account was charged twice. There can be issues with the system at times and would like to discuss this with you as soon as you can. Please know that is not how we like to conduct business and that we are working on making changes to solve these issues regarding customer service. Again, we do apologize for this inconvenience to you and if you would like, please call Caleb at (205) 988-6400.

text: My massage therapist was very kind, but she started late and ended early. The pre-massage wait wasn't very relaxing (should have had a much more calming waiting experience). Comparing to other experiences, this was pretty lack luster.

name: Haley Messer
text: I scheduled an appointment at the Massage Envy in Hoover over a week in advance and received a reminder phone call and voicemail the day before my scheduled massage to confirm the time and date. I arrived at the location at the scheduled time and they claimed that my appointment was on a different day. I told them I had received a voicemail confirming that the appointment time was, in fact, when I thought it was. They "apologized" by telling me that they have made the same mistake in the past and there was nothing they can do. They have a policy stating that clients must cancel at least 1 day before the massage to avoid wasting the therapist's time and I find it disrespectful and unprofessional that they don't hold themselves to the same standards. They were unapologetic and appeared unconcerned by the mistake. Don't waste your time on the poor customer service at this Massage Envy.

resp.text: Haley, we’re sorry to hear about your recent experience and thank you for sharing your feedback. Please continue letting us know how we can improve so we can better our services.

I reminded her that I had changed the time of my facial to an earlier time yesterday and she got an attitude and was like no there's only one person that does the facial and she was already booked, well why didn't you tell me that yesterday!! text: Astonishing results after just two visits. I move around a lot as a working Mom of twins. If you want to feel unquestionably healthier go see Brice. My husband gave me a gift certificate to get a massage and it's the best gift he's ever given me!

text: I had such a wonderful experience at Birmingham Wellness Massage. The therapist I worked with was so professional and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Birmingham Wellness Massage and will absolutely be going back very soon!!

text: Brice is an amazing massage therapist. I recommend him not only on here but to my friends when they mention aches and pains. I go monthly to get all of the stress I hold on to in my muscles. It is the most relaxing part of my month and worth every penny!

name: Tori Quinn
text: Brice has been my personal massage therapist for a while now, and he is hands down the best therapist I've ever been to. He does more than just a "feel good" massage but takes the time to really help you therapeutically. Brice will stretch you out and will pay close attention to the pressure level you can stand and/or want. His attention to the small things is the best. The cooling eye pillow, the fluffy neck pillow, these kinds of things I've never gotten from another therapist. This will absolutely be one of the best, if not THE best, massage you've ever had.

name: David Hunter
text: Brice has been my best therapist.  I've been going to him for years now, and I like how he listens to you.  He is willing to make adjustments in the session to focus on any tight areas.  The atmosphere is very relaxing.  It has always been easy to make appointments, and Brice is quick to respond.  Brice makes everything about your massage relaxing and easy just like it should be.

text: Brice and his team are the best! His therapists are highly skilled and treat you just like you’re  family. I wouldn’t even consider recommending my family and friends to anyone else.

I look forward to my regularly scheduled appointment each month and know when I come out I will be changed to a more relaxed individual.  He can taylor your massage for your needs and I feel like I’ve never had the same massage twice. Do yourself a favor and schedule yourself an appointment soon. You won’t regret it !

name: Deborah Tankersley
text: Don't know what I would do without them. Dr Joseph and Dr Amy are both really great. It's no routine rush though appointment here..they do what it takes to get back on tract! Great staff as well.

name: Lisa Perkins
text: I've been going to HealthSource in Providence for 2 years now. I started going for a specific problem with my lower back which was fixed almost immediately with proper alighnment. I now go monthly to stay in alighnment. Dr Joe and Dr Amy are so nice, knowledgeable,  and do such a great job. Their office staff are also nice, efficient and helpful. They offer so many different therapies as well as chiropractic care that there's something that's helpful for everyone. I highly recommend their practice to anyone looking for great chiropractoic healthcare.

name: Kathy DeMellier
text: Dr. Joseph and Amy are amazing at what they do. They are very caring and really listen to their patients. The staff that work with them are a great asset to their practice as well. Very satisfied with their services and would highly recommend them.

name: Conni Sullivan
text: Dr.'s are excellent. Very accommodating. Friendly from check in to check out. Very clean, modern atmosphere. I enjoy reading all the information provided in the waiting area and consult area.

name: T W
text: Friendly and extremely productive staff! A very professional place where your chiropractic needs are taken care of. I definitely recommend them!

name: Rebecca Webber
text: I always get great care from Dr. Joseph and Dr. Amy.  Angel is cheerful  and efficient.  I look forward to my visits with them and leave feeling much better.

name: Caroline Logan
text: What a wonderful team. Dr. Joseph and Dr. Amy Lawrence are great doctors and provide top level care for every patient!

name: jeffrey graham
text: Dr. Joseph and Dr. Amy seriously improved my quality of life.  I was having some really intense migranes about every 2 weeks.  I started seeing the doctors and after about two months of intense work, I am happy to say that I no longer have migranes.  The Lawrences were dedicated to helping me solve the problem.  They did a combination of adjustments, theraputic exercises and massage.  They require you to do some work on your end (mostly exercises at home) but I could not be more happy with my experience.  I haven't had a migrane in almost 4 years.  I'll always be grateful for their help.

name: Chris Packman
text: People there are super nice and the care is 👍

name: Sharon Lampert
text: The entire staff takes the time to listen to you and adjusts you accordingly. I would highly recommend them to all.

name: Yvonne Findley
text: Always feel better after an adjustment.
